metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4128 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in net/sched/cls_fw.c in classifiers (cls_fw, cls_u32, and cls_route) in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows a local attacker to perform a local privilege escalation due to incorrect handling of the existing filter, leading to a kernel information leak issue. It was discovered that some network classifier implementations in the Linux kernel contained use-after-free vulnerabilities. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> the fix commits can be found split in CVE-2023-4206, CVE-2023-4207 and CVE-2023-4208. these 3 are likely to be marked as duplicated.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.129').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
